I am really happy that they are adding rescources. I can not get my mods installed properly for the life of me

Mun looks like having an imflammation. Poor Mun!

Actually the resource system will be something that gives us something to do that actually makes sense. Really like it.

Now we can fly forever! Without infinite fuel!

Provided that we have enough Delta V and can get the resource in the first place...

I'm just happy that a resource version will be stock.

Some ideas:

- Add more biomes (or regions within biomes) so you can have a difference between the north and south pole. Or that the ocean biome is not planet-wide.

- Add a way to weight one end of the biome more then the other by resource, so that the far east end has a 10% concentration and the far west end is only a 2% concentration.
My only real question is do we also get SCANsat?

I dislike those drills. There should be a spinning jenny and a turntable that is fed pipe from a snail drum via automated power tongs so there isn't a drill length issue. Adding/tripping pipe would just be a loop until the drill bit hits whatever total depth is determined by the game. And instead of a well cap an arm could just lock onto the pipe head and a little pump could suck whatever out of the ground. And there should be a little control platform requiring a kerbal to man it. Or kerbal it. I'm not sure what the correct verb would be. But it should require a Kerbal... perhaps specifically an Engineer to act as driller?

Maybe I should make an actual model and post it in the Suggestions forum for people to mock.

Oh, and a drill that folds/tips back 90Ã‚Â° for storage so we can mount drills in cargo bays.

Over-analysis of the drill structure aside, some of us have been griping that there's little reason for our Kerbals to ever go EVA aside from science bumps. I'd love more EVA interactions for the Kerbals, and the drills would be a good start.

As it is they're just another kind of science part, which are dull as dirt right now.

I bet that Ore will be highly concentrated on many asteroids, making asteroid redirect missions really useful.
